TopicTitle: The Draco - Interplanetary Vessel Design (aka: way too much docking)

Articles.Content:
So I've been waiting for a Duna Launch Window and since I couldnt imagine a space agency just sitting around... we've been building. And test landing on the Mun and Minmus. Which brings me to Projects Aquila and later Draco:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It currently (*as of the edit*) has two landers:

The N-A.D./A. Vehicle (Non-atmospheric Descent/Ascent) to be used for the Mun, Minmus and potentially Ike.

and

The G.L.A.E./A. Vehicle (Gravitationally Low Atmospheric Entry/Ascent) to be used for Duna.

And a Wyvern Crew Transfer Vehicle, which is capable of returning crew back to Kerbin safely.

Edited August 21, 2013 by N3Coalition
Added new picture.

Ah, docking. Docking is just wonderful isn't it. I find it interesting that you did this by docking each module individually. Right now I am creating a ship almost exactly like this, but I am going to send it up all in one go. Trust me, it makes life a lot less painful if you can get it up in one piece.

I've been trying to avoid use of asparagus staging for more realistic ascent lifters, unfortunately this limits the tonnage that I can lift into space.

And for some reason the VAB doesnt like my two docking modules idea. I tried to replicate it first by building the whole thing to see if two sr docking ports would work but... I don't think the VAB liked it. XD

The only other advantage I can think of is that with it being highly modular, if it ever gets damaged, you can simply send replacement modules instead of a whole new ship. Other than that, I guess it was also a learning experience for how to multidock, lol.

The thing should have roughly 9,000 m/s of Delta V without any payload, so I think this might be overkill for Duna. Oh well.

That is a good point about being modular. It does allow for the replacement of parts. I did not use asparagus to lift my ship, I used 20 large fuel tanks and medium fuel tanks with 16 skippers and 4 mainsails. It works pretty well, the only flaw is that I messed up fuel flow, making it spin badly. Don't be afraid to just strap a ton of boosters on it and see if it explodes.

Tenuous

Tedious

I'm terribly sorry for doing this, but it just burned my soul.

-Ojimak

Edited August 21, 2013 by Ojimak

I probably still used it incorrectly but when I wrote that, I was think about how precarious things floating at each other relatively quickly was.

Though this whole thing has been pretty tedious. Engineering hindsight-the comm tower is in the way. DX so I lifted up an extender, so that port will be used for refueling.

But I will try to be more careful with those two words in he future. c:
